topics.body:
its rather weird how the juggalo part of gamzee gets to play a really big role later on.

also, i have noticed terezi has had a radical change of personality in the later arcs.

she started all flirty, friendly, hyperactive, a bit sociopathic and all that show

now she is introverted, barely talks, and whe she talks its like some sentences, rather self depricative and misterious, she even hides her face behind a dragon cape

shit has hit her hard, hell she threatened to kill a troll that tried to get close to karkat

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54684eb06368722ca91d0200#post_54684eb06368722ca91d0200
I was talking quality overall. The thing about Bleach is Kubo doesn't know how to write. He has the POTENTIAL to be a good writer but he has no idea what character development or pacing is. And his artwork is really lacking. To be fair his character designs are godlike but with things like panel layout and backgrounds he gets sooooooo lazy.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54684f3f63687279c31b0000#post_54684f3f63687279c31b0000

It was all good, then Soul Society ended and seems he's been trying to make that lightning strike twice ~It brings some sour memories to another series the more I think about it...~

We will never forget "The Heart".
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54684fe1636872564fee0100#post_54684fe1636872564fee0100
Kubo relies on a very paticular narrative crutch. When he doesn't know how to progress the story forward he does a very VERY bad thing. He introduces more characters. The problem with that is when you have so many characters you don't have the time needed to develop them properly. So they inevitably end up with little to no personality. He also uses waaaaaaaaay too many two-page spreads.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54684dcd6368727e22540100#post_54684dcd6368727e22540100
Which is why I added the addendum, "When phrased properly." When phrased _improperly_, it makes the writer look like a dumbass.
